Hello Matthew, 
I've found some resources that might help you understand different maintenance measurement methods and policies.
This document discusses strategies for measuring depreciation and the value of maintenance for facilities:
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/3675/Building_a_Plan_What_city_and_county_managers_need_to_know_to_create_an_effective_facilities_mainten
This document tells the story of how Bangalore, India took inspiration from Reno, Nevada in developing its road maintenance programs:
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/50733/Case_Study_Preventive_Maintenance_of_Roads_and_Sidewalks_in_Bangalore_India
I hope these help you and your organization.
Gabe Brehm
Knowledge Network Intern
ICMA

Hi Matthew,
In Raleigh, we just recently tried to break down the time commitments of our facilities maintenance staff, and we actually don't even do work orders for our preventive maintenance.  All of our work orders are reactive, and most of our maintenance staff are either 100% committed to preventive maintenance or work orders.  However, we do keep track of our preventive maintenance tasks in separate spreadsheets so that we know what needs to be completed.  Recently, we estimated that approximately 57% of our time is spent on PM and 43% is spent on unscheduled maintenance.  This is the first time we've really tried to track this, so we haven't set standards or benchmarks for it, but we did determine that we're going to need to try to squeeze a few more positions out of this year's budget in order to meet our needs in both maintenance areas.

author: Matthew Bronson
text:
We are reviewing our city facilities maintenance program including the extent of our preventative maintenance work.  In San Mateo, our current goal is to have at least 50% of our total work orders comprised of preventative maintenance work orders.  I'd like to know what other jurisdictions use as a goal to measure the extent of preventative maintenance work completed.  Thanks.  
Matt Bronson
Interim Streets and Facilities Manager
City of San Mateo, CA
title: Preventative maintenance as a percentage of maintenance work
